name: Relais Christine

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We've been Relais Christine before and loved it (2008) So we came back and were VERY disappointed. For €370,00 = $550 we were put in a very small, very stuffy, very dark and very purple room on the 3rd floor, just under the roof. Since I have been travelling the world I always check for emergency exits and was not happy at all with what I found .. it's quite a jump from the third floor down.
reviews.title: Depressed in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we fired off the airco we had a choice: either the noise or the heat since the airco apparently had not been used since opening day and tried hard (a bit too hard for our taste) to do its work - so open the windows. Not a good idea since garbage collection in Paris is at 5am so a short night. To get wide awake I took the shower which resulted in a very wet wooden bathroom floor where we spotted some until now unknown fungus that apparently did love the wooden floor. My wife took the bath.. We got use to wash one by one one since there was no place fot two in the bathroom but the toilet was ok. All in all I do not think we'll be back..
reviews.title: Top Class
Great Boutique Hotel all-around
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the Relais Christine. The staff were friendly (by Parisian standards) and they upgraded our Dulexe room to a Suite on arrival. It's a very romantic hotel and not pretentious like so many of the 5 star hotels in Paris. My only gripe is that 30€ for a continental breakfast is somewhat steep, however there are so many great cafes around that it's not a problem (don't expect the service you'd get in the US or UK though).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great experience recently. They have a marvelous spa in the lower level - exercise room, hot tub with nearby showers, etc. Breakfast quite good although there may be a short wait for staff to clear tables. Honor bar in their Library Room was enjoyable. Free wi-fi in the lobby and the Library Room generally worked well. Great beds! Marvelous location, and they were very helpful in making all our restaurant reservations. Would definitely stay there again!
reviews.title: Great location
Enchanting and a perfect location
reviews.text: We thought the location of this hotel was fantastic. While the hotel itself seemed a bit old, the room was clean, quiet, and relatively spacious for Paris.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.title: Absolutely perfect stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What an amazing and romantic hotel! A very old building which has been gently renovated, maintaining the old charm but also modernized giving all the comfort! A wonderful entrance through a beautiful courtyard into a lovely reception area. We were warmly welcomed by the excellent staff. We had booked a Deluxe room with SLH but where upgraded to a Duplex on the third (top) floor. The room was recently refurbished (which I had requested after given such recommendation in other reviews) and it was top of the line! Downstairs a sofa (bed sofa), table, flat screen TV, bar and stereo. Several windows giving nice and light view. A smaller dressing room with plenty of clothing space. Next the modern and beautiful bathroom having 2 washbasins, bathtub and a separate shower with a rain shower. Great! Upstairs was the bedroom with small working desk, a built-in bookcase and another flat screen tv. Good size, very comfortable and lovely decorated. Since this the top floor, attic, the ceilings bended slightly and it was fitted with a skylight window. The whole Duplex was very comfortable, nice size and really cozy. Modern but yet with an older touch and charm. For instance, all lightening can be dimmed and skylight window has an electric curtain. The hotel doesn’t have a restaurant (although 24 hours room service) but there are many excellent places to eat just outside the hotel. They have an “honesty” bar which is very charming and you get the feeling of being at home in your own living room. There is a breakfast room, a spa and a fitness room in the basement, none of which we managed to see, but no doubts in the same charming spirit as the rest of the hotel. One downside point: although accessible wireless internet in the room, it is not free of charge (must be changed!!!). Hotel offer free wireless in the “honesty” bar and use of stationary computer in separate room. As mentioned before, the staff is friendly, services minded and efficient. I have stayed several times at the Pavillion de la Reine on Place des Vosges which is one of my favorite places in Paris, both the hotel and the location. Relais Christine is now definitely another of my preferred hotels in Paris with a similar charm in the attractive St Germain area. Don’t hesitate to go there! We shall return!!
reviews.title: Charming, great location, great breakfast

reviews.text: I seek out charming boutique hotels when I travel. I love finding places like Relais Christine which has just the right mixture of luxury and charm.
reviews.title: excellent service, lovely hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My first trip to Paris I stayed at L'Hotel. I hated it and left after one night.
reviews.title: Beautiful and Friendly Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the recommendation of a friend I tried Relais Christine on my next trip. I could not have been happier. The rooms have a bit of a modern decor but they feature air conditioning, GREAT beds (especially for France). The rooms are cozy and romantic. The hotel lobby has a more traditional french country decor and the breakfast room is located in a cellar with tons of character.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Relais Christine for a couple nights during our travels through Europe to celebrate our 20th anniversary. We were here the night of our anniversary, and the staff sent up a bottle of champagne to help us celebrate, which was surprising and delightful. They also cheerfully canceled a dinner reservation they had made for us when I wasn't feeling well and decided to eat nearby (we wound up walking over to the Rue de Buci for "take out", which was perfect). This was my 4th trip to Paris, and Relais Christine is my favorite hotel experience so far in this city - excellent location, quiet, clean, modern amenities yet charming decor, and friendly staff. And I'm still having fun telling my friends about the $40 USD continental breakfast!
reviews.title: Quiet and Comfort in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here on our anniversary two years ago, and we're going back. The location was unbeatable, the inn itself was charming, but the best part about the hotel was the staff. They crushed all the stereotypes about the "arrogant French". They couldn't have been more polite and accomodating, and the concergie was spot on about restaurant recommendations.
reviews.title: Charming hotel with excellent service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A delightful hotel with lots of ambience and charm especially loved the bar set up of an honesty system very polished. The staff are very obliging and friendly especially the lovely lady in the breakfast area greeting us each morning with a welcoming and friendly smile and not to forget the lovely gentleman who assisted with our luggage no matter how heavy it was. Rooms are charming with every comfort you could not want for more being so far from home. Thanks to the staff at Relais Christine for making our stay so comfortable.
reviews.title: Delightful and charming Chic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great boutique hotel ! Love the lounge area and honest bar. It feels like my living room... Fantastic touch and attention to detail. Much better than the so called 5 star deluxe hotel that we stayed at a few days prior in Rome. I would come back here in a heart beat. Very posh and quaint.
reviews.title: Fantasic Romantic Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It had been my wife's dream to stay at the Relais Christine, and this summer we finally did it. It was my eighth trip to Paris and I had never stayed in a luxury hotel before. Pluses: I cannot imagine a better location, unless you are going to Paris for a very long stay. A block from the river (for sightseeing), Rue de Buci and Blvd St Germain (for eating and shopping) yet quiet--I mean pin-drop, like a tomb, quiet! I have never had a room in Paris which was so isolated from street noise. Room was tastefully outfitted, unlike some Paris rooms which seem to decorated within an inch of their lives; it had a lovely small balcony overlooking the courtyard, on the first floor. For our anniversary, the staff gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne. When we needed anything, like ice or directions, the hotel staff was obliging and speedy. The bathroom was excellent, with a long tub (I am tall, so I appreciated this.) Cons: the superior room was not huge for the money (300 E), although roomy enough for two chairs and desk. (I gather the classic rooms are smaller, and would not recommend them if that is true.) And we did not take the breakfast: 30E ($40) pp is a ridiculous price to pay when there are great cafes, boulangeries and patisseries literally around the corner on Rue de Buci (Carton is legendary), where you can get the best pastry of your life, or on St Andre des Arts where you can get juice, snacks, pizza, etc. You are paying only for convenience and fancy china. All things considered, though, the hotel was an outstanding Paris experience and we would definitely repeat it, for a short stay. Location, location!
reviews.title: excellent luxury hotel

reviews.text: We had a wonderful week at the Relais Christine this July. A picturesque, charming and quiet place in the heart of a very old but hopping part of Paris. The staff makes a great team and we felt that they did everything to make our first visit in Paris, France aan unforgetable experience.
reviews.title: Lovely romantic hotel in the heart of old Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We know that space in this area is scarce and dear, and they do their best to make use of every centimeter. It helped that they stored away our luggage and that were happy to continue to store it for the time we left Paris.
reviews.title: Another Great Stay at Relais Christine

reviews.title: Understated Elegance

description: The Relais Christine, built on the foundations of a 13th-century abbey, is your Left Bank peaceful haven. Behind the gate is a cosy world and an ambiance of fine antiques. The 51 guest rooms and suites, all individually decorated, are stylish comfortable, some of them with a private terrace on the garden. Enjoy a peaceful haven in the garden or unwind after a day of sightseeing in the hotel’s spa with Carita treatments.
